bibl.title: Ancient Readers of Pindar's Epinicians in Egypt: Evidence from Papyri.
bibl.note: Contribution presented at the four-day conference 'Epinician: An International Conference on the Victory Ode' which took place on July 5-9 2006 in Bloomsbury, London. - 1. Ancient reception of Pindar: sources and research perspectives. - 2. Pindar's epinicians: an overview of the papyri. - 3. Typologies of bookrolls. - 4. P. Oxy. XXXI, 2536 (= M.-P.3 1498.2; LDAB 4015): collective transcription of Pindar exegesis at Oxyrhynchus? - 5. Scholarly activity on Pindar's Victory Odes. - 6. Conclusions. - P. 140: Addendum [about P. Oxy. LXXV, 5035-5045].

bibl.title: Receiving the Komos. Ancient & Modern Receptions of the Victory Ode

bibl.seg: Giuseppe Ucciardello, Ancient Readers of Pindar's Epinicians in Egypt: Evidence from Papyri.
Peter Agócs, Chris Carey & Richard Rawles (edd.), Receiving the Komos. Ancient & Modern Receptions of the Victory Ode = BICS. Supplement 112 (London, 2012) pp. 105-140, 1 tabl.

Contribution presented at the four-day conference 'Epinician: An International Conference on the Victory Ode' which took place on July 5-9 2006 in Bloomsbury, London. - 1. Ancient reception of Pindar: sources and research perspectives. - 2. Pindar's epinicians: an overview of the papyri. - 3. Typologies of bookrolls. - 4. P. Oxy. XXXI, 2536 (= M.-P.3 1498.2; LDAB 4015): collective transcription of Pindar exegesis at Oxyrhynchus? - 5. Scholarly activity on Pindar's Victory Odes. - 6. Conclusions. - P. 140: Addendum [about P. Oxy. LXXV, 5035-5045].
